goals.question: What is the distribution of flight delays?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the frequency of flight delays and the range of delay times.

goals.question: What is the relationship between distance and flight time?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of distance vs. air_time
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there is a correlation between distance and flight time. It can also help us identify any outliers or anomalies.

goals.question: What is the most common origin airport?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify the airport with the highest number of flights and can help us understand the popularity of certain airports.

goals.question: What is the distribution of flight cancellations?
goals.visualization: Pie chart of cancelled vs. not cancelled flights
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the proportion of cancelled flights in the dataset and can help us identify any patterns or trends in cancellations.

goals.question: What is the average departure delay for each airline?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of airline vs. average departure_delay
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us compare the average departure delay for each airline and can help us identify which airlines have the most delays.

code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['departure_delay'] = pd.to_numeric(data['departure_delay'], errors='coerce')
    data = data[pd.notna(data['departure_delay'])]
    
    plt.hist(data['departure_delay'], bins=30, color='blue', alpha=0.7, label='Departure Delays')
    plt.axvline(data['departure_delay'].median(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=2, label=f"Median: {data['departure_delay'].median():.2f}")
    
    plt.xlabel('Departure Delay (minutes)')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of flight delays?', wrap=True)
    plt.legend()
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.scatter(data['distance'], data['air_time'])
    plt.xlabel('Distance')
    plt.ylabel('Flight Time')
    plt.title('What is the relationship between distance and flight time?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    origin_counts = data['origin_airport'].value_counts()
    origin_counts.plot(kind='bar', color='blue', legend=True)
    plt.title('What is the most common origin airport?', wrap=True)
    plt.xlabel('Origin Airport')
    plt.ylabel('Number of Flights')
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    plt.legend(['Origin Airport'])
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    cancelled_counts = data['cancelled'].value_counts()
    labels = ['Not Cancelled', 'Cancelled']
    colors = ['blue', 'red']
    
    plt.pie(cancelled_counts, labels=labels, colors=colors, autopct='%1.1f%%')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of flight cancellations?', wrap=True)
    plt.legend(labels, loc='upper right')
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['departure_delay'] = pd.to_numeric(data['departure_delay'], errors='coerce')
    data = data[pd.notna(data['departure_delay'])]
    
    avg_departure_delay = data.groupby('airline')['departure_delay'].mean().reset_index()
    
    fig, ax = plt.subplots()
    ax.bar(avg_departure_delay['airline'], avg_departure_delay['departure_delay'])
    
    plt.title('What is the average departure delay for each airline?', wrap=True)
    plt.xlabel('Airline')
    plt.ylabel('Average Departure Delay')
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    
    for i, v in enumerate(avg_departure_delay['departure_delay']):
        ax.text(i, v + 0.5, f"{v:.2f}", ha='center', fontsize=8)
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
